intro: Senecio oreophilus, commonly known as the mountain groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Senecio oreophilus is a hardy species that is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
